text: Noel W. Campbell (born December 1941) is a Republican member of the Arizona House of Representatives representing Arizona's Legislative District One, alongside Steve Pierce.https://www.signalsaz.com/articles/noel-campbell- focuses-on-transportation-water-and-roads-in-pursuit-of-arizona-house-of- representatives-third-term/ ==Political experience== Campbell was elected in 2014, and this is his first elected position. He succeeded Speaker of the House Andy Tobin. He previously served in the Navy, retiring from the Naval Reserve with the rank of Commander. He has also served in the U.S. Customs Service, the U.S. Forest Service, and is a small business owner. ==Elections== In 2014, Campbell successfully ran alongside Karen Fann. Campbell came in second behind Fann and ahead of Democratic challenger Frank Cucciain the general election with 43,864 votes. ==References== ==External links== * Category:Members of the Arizona House of Representatives Category:Arizona Republicans Category:Living people Category:United States Customs Service personnel Category:21st-century American politicians Category:1941 births
title: Noel W. Campbell
